intro: Trachydium simplicifolium, commonly known as the simple-leaved trachydium, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
